data.title: Best salad bar downtown but skip the hot bar's veggies
data.text: I stop in at least once a week for the fresh & well stocked salad bar. They sell by the pound and you can eat in or take it to go. The balsamic dressing is house made and delicious. I only grabbed food from the hot bar once and was disappointed, as the veggies were very salty. I threw them away because they were too salty toe at. So, stick with the salad bar. The employees are helpful and friendly as well. The shop also stocks beer and wines if you are looking for something special to drink. Overall, a great addition to downtown!

data.title: Terrific Little Marketplace!
data.text:
Come - sit for a spell! Enjoy the Little Green Hive coffee shop, the hot/cold buffet, the 'Noke Truck crepes, Cork & Crust pizza and drinks, or come to Crossing church that meets here on Sunday! This place is such a neat little marketplace - sit, eat, drink coffee...or beer! It's so nice to just come and sit in on Roanoke community and meet new friends!

Or, come at night and on the weekends and join in with whatever festivities or dances this place happily hosts!

This is my favorite chill place in Roanoke!

data.title: Nice downtown food court and gathering spot
data.text: Went to 16 West for lunch today this is a relatively new addition to Roanoke and appears to be an alternative to the city market building a few blocks away. Several vendors are inside I specifically went to S&W Specialty market. The market serves sandwiches along with a salad bar that has hot food. The Salad bar is $7.95 per pound which seems high to me but, the wife says it is comparable to what you find in stores like Krogers, Fresh market. I got salad along with some of the hot food items. Two loaded plates and two iced teas ran $26. The market also had a good collection of craft beers. Another vendor is Cork and Crust which is a little bar area. Another area houses Café 16 a nice looking upscale coffee shop.
